tum.dss.thesis

Interface PlayerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlayer, Player

    public interface PlayerInterface
    Interface for an individual player in the mechanism data. It stores or calculates the valuations.
    Author:
    Florian Stallmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dropOriginalValuations()
      Method to remove all given valuations.
      String getName()
      Gets the name of this player.
      double getValuation(int j)
      Gets the valuation for given subset index (use oracle if necessary).
      void resetValuations()
      Method to set all valuations to zero.
      void setItemsetHandler(ItemsetHandlerInterface itemset)
      Injects itemset which is needed to calculate the valuations of subsets.
      void setValuation(int j, double v)
      Sets a single valuation for given subset index (takes care of monotonicity automatically).
      void setValuations(double[] v)
      Sets the valuation for all subsets (override existing).

    • Method Detail

      • getValuation

        double getValuation(int j)
        Gets the valuation for given subset index (use oracle if necessary).
        Parameters:
        j - index of set.
        Returns:
        valuation.

      • setValuations

        void setValuations(double[] v)
        Sets the valuation for all subsets (override existing).

        The index of the array must equal the index of the subset. The array has to be monotone as this method will not check for monotonicity.

        Parameters:
        v - valuation as double array.

      • setValuation

        void setValuation(int j,
                  double v)
        Sets a single valuation for given subset index (takes care of monotonicity automatically).

        This method is the implementation of the first part of Claim 3.3. It will monotonize the valuation of this player for all supersets. If a subset has a higher valuation this this update will be skipped. Hence, it is not possible to decrease a valuation if a subset with a higher valuation already exists. It is important that each time the ellipsoid method updates all player valuation the resetValuation method is called before. This happens in EllipsoidMethodData.updatePlayerValuation(org.jscience.mathematics.vector.Vector).

        Parameters:
        j - index of set.
        v - valuation.

      • dropOriginalValuations

        void dropOriginalValuations()
        Method to remove all given valuations.

      • resetValuations

        void resetValuations()
        Method to set all valuations to zero.

      • setItemsetHandler

        void setItemsetHandler(ItemsetHandlerInterface itemset)
        Injects itemset which is needed to calculate the valuations of subsets.
        Parameters:
        itemset - itemset of underlying mechanism data.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this player.
        Returns:
        player name.
